snippet: A decision to reverse the European Union’s designation of the group came amid a swell of opinion in favor of recognizing a Palestinian state.
abstract: European Union's General Court reverses bloc's designation of militant Palestinian group Hamas as terrorist organization, straining relations with Israel; court's decision coincides with increased European impatience with stalled Middle East peace effort and with European Parliament's vote to recognize Palestinian statehood in principal.

byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem, Majd Al Waheidi from Gaza and Steven Erlanger from London.

lead_paragraph: A decision to reverse the European Union’s designation of the group came amid a swell of opinion in favor of recognizing a Palestinian state.

headline.main: European Court Reverses Designation of Hamas as a Terrorist Organization
headline.print_headline: European Court Reverses Designation of Hamas as a Terrorist Organization
